subject: Re: [junit] @RunWith more than one runner?
msgSnippet: I didn t expect you to be familiar with ClassLoaderSuite, although you might remember the concept from my questions several weeks ago.  I wrote it.  There s a
messageBody:
I didn't expect you to be familiar with ClassLoaderSuite, although you
might remember the concept from my questions several weeks ago. I
wrote it. There's a pointer to the code below.

I'm not sure what kind of stack trace you're interested in. The failure
I'm seeing is that my parameterized test simply doesn't run.



Kent Beck wrote on 1/11/10 3:31 PM:
> Bill,
>
> Thanks for the question. I'm not familiar with ClassLoaderSuite. I might be able to help if I could see the stack trace when you run a regular test and compare it to the stack trace when you run a parameterized test.
>
> Regards,
>
> Kent
>
> On Jan 11, 2010, at 1:20 PM, Bill Shannon wrote:
>
>> I created a Suite that allows me to run tests in a separate class loader.
>> I use it like this:
>>
>> @RunWith(ClassLoaderSuite.class)
>> @SuiteClasses({ MyTest1.class, MyTest2.class })
>> @TestClass(ClassToTest.class)
>> public class MyTestSuite {
>> }
>>
>> If I want one of those tests to be parameterized, should I expect to
>> be able to do:
>>
>> @RunWith(Parameterized.class)
>> public class MyTest1 {
>> ...
>> }
>>
>> It doesn't seem to work.
>>
>> What would I have to do in ClassLoaderSuite to make this work?
>>
>> FYI, you can find ClassLoaderSuite.java at:
>> http://kenai.com/projects/javamail/sources/mercurial/content/mail/src/test/java/com/sun/mail/test/ClassLoaderSuite.java?rev=231
>>
>
>
>
> [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
>
>
>
